data.title: Arthur Ashe (Tennis Player)
data.meta_description: Arthur Ashe was ranked number one in the world and won three Grand Slam titles. An African American, he was the first black player ever selected to the...
data.text:
Arthur Ashe

Profession: Tennis Player

Biography: Arthur Ashe was ranked number one in the world and won three Grand Slam titles. An African American, he was the first black player ever selected to the United States Davis Cup team and the only black man ever to win the singles title at Wimbledon, the US Open, and the Australian Open.

He is thus considered to be one of the best tennis players from the United States in history.

Born: July 10, 1943

Birthplace: Richmond, Virginia, USA

Generation: Silent Generation

Chinese Zodiac: Goat/Sheep

Star Sign: Cancer

Died: February 6, 1993 (aged 49)

Cause of Death: AIDS-related pneumonia

Married Life

American world No. 1 tennis player Arthur Ashe (33) weds Indo-Guadeloupean-African-American photographer Jeanne Moutoussamy at the Church Center for the United Nations in New York City in ceremony officiated by US Ambassador to the UN Andrew Young

Historical Events

Arthur Ashe becomes first African-American tennis player to be named in the US Davis Cup team

Australian Championships Men's Tennis: Roy Emerson makes it 4 straight Australian titles; beats American Arthur Ashe 6-4, 6-8, 6-2, 6-3

Australian Championships Men's Tennis: Roy Emerson repeats previous year's result; beats American Arthur Ashe 6-4, 6-1, 6-4 for his 5th straight Australian title

Arthur Ashe becomes 1st African American to win the US singles championship

US Open Men's Tennis, Forest Hills, NY: Arthur Ashe wins first Open era US title; beats Dutchman Tom Okker 14-12, 5-7, 6-3, 3-6, 6-3

Arthur Ashe becomes 1st black person be ranked #1 in tennis

Australian Open Men's Tennis: Arthur Ashe beats big serving local Dick Crealy 6-4, 9-7, 6-2

Australian Open Men's Tennis: Ken Rosewall of Australia beats American defending champion Arthur Ashe 6-1, 7-5, 6-3; first man to win an Open era Grand Slam singles title without dropping a set

US Open Men's Tennis, Forest Hills, NY: Ilie Năstase of Romania beats Arthur Ashe 3-6, 6-3, 6-7, 6-3, 6-3 for his first Grand Slam title

Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Arthur Ashe becomes first African-American to win Wimbledon, beats countryman Jimmy Connors 6-1, 6-1, 5-7, 6-4

John McEnroe wins his first of 3 season-ending ATP Masters Grand Prix tennis titles 6–7, 6–3, 7–5 against fellow American Arthur Ashe at Madison Square Garden, NYC

Arthur Ashe retires from professional tennis

Tennis ace Arthur Ashe undergoes double bypass heart surgery

Arthur Ashe is nominated for the International Tennis Hall of Fame

Arthur Ashe is named Sports Illustrated Sportsperson of the Year

Famous Tennis Players

Agnieszka Radwańska

Alexander Zverev

Charlotte Cooper

Ernest Renshaw

Hana Mandlikova

Kurt Nielsen
